content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												Výborná hra.+ Atmosféra, výpravy jak v Dračím Doupěti na kterém jsem vyrostl - jidlo, pochodne, lektvary - chce to trošku strategie abyste vydrželi do konce,+ Stejně tak to chce přemýšlet jaký tým do které lokality vezmete. Třeba charaktery zaměřené na krvacivé útoky na kostlivce asi ne =)+/-  Někdo by to mohl počítat za záporný rys hry, ale to, že hrdinové často umírají vám dává pocit opravdovosti. Ze začatku (jako milovníka Baldurs Gate atd) mi trochu vadilo, že mi hrdinové umírají. S tím, že hra nema žádný save/load si je budete hýčkat o poznaní citelněji.+ Hra se ukládá non-stop. Můžete ji kdykoliv vypnout a kdykoliv zapnout, hra se načte přesně na stejném místě. (platí i pro souboje atd). To dělá hru časově nenáročnou (přesto že celkové dohání časově náročné je), v klidu si dokážete užít hru i během půl hodiny.+ Hra se dá hrát donekonečna. Pokud chcete, dá se dokončit tuším za 20-30h. Ale klidně i za 200h, 300h atd. +/- Nedoporučil bych hru lidem, kteří chtějí intenzivní herní zážitek, a chtějí u té hry prosedět celou dovolenou (i takoví se najdou :-) . Protože hra začne být po čase dosti stereotypní. Ale těm, kdo se chtějí sem tam ponořit do temného gotického světa, s partou hrdinů procházet kobky, jeskyně a temné lesy, bude hra úchvatným zážitkem.+ Hrdinové trpí dosti reálnými neduhy, od obyčejných nemocí a úrazů přes psychycké problémy.Může se klidně stát, že budete mít v partě kleptomanku, která si poklad sem tam ukradne pro sebe, fanatika, který se bdue hrabat v hrobech ať už se vám to líbí nebo ne atd. Uroveň světla a jiné drobnosti na výpravě pusobí i na psychiku hrdinů. Někteří v sobě najdou skrytou sílu, jiným přeskočí. S tím souvisí i vylepšování vesničky, kde najdete budovy i jako kostel, nemocnici či hospodu. Tam všude můžou hrdinové za nemalý peníz odpočívat a relaxovat nebo se léčit. Pokud nebudete opatrní, budou tuto kúru potřebovat po každé výpravě. +Sběr artefaktů a pokladů. Každý hrdina může nést až dva artefakty nehledě na vylepšení zbroje a zbraní. Oboje je znatelné vylepšení, tak nevahejte investovat do dražších. Ale pozor, opilý hrdina může artefakt klidně ztratit :-)Shrnuto, podtrženo: hra se vyplatí ve všech ohledech (ano pokud uvažujete nad tím, koupit jídlo na víkend nebo hru tak se asi nevyplatí, jinak ano). Nikdy jsem neviděl hru, kde by bylo tolik reálných prvků hru ovlivňujíc. Sečteno s úžasnou kreslenou grafikou a temnou hudbou i atmosférou, 9,5/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Probably one of the best Early Access games out right now. That said, there are still some things I dislike about the game. 1. The RNG can feel a little TOO RNG and doesn't feel like you can manipulate it enough in your favor early on. 2. Buffs besides the Jester's Battle Ballad seem extremely underwhelming as you could just as easily deal more damage or keep yourself from taking more damage by attacking instead. 3. The lock on lower level quests when a character hits level 3 kind of sucks. It makes sense that they did this since it keeps on from power leveling characters, but since there is no middle point between dungeon lvls 3 and 1 (i.e. lvl 2) it is a huge spike in difficulty especially if one does not yet have the money/resources to unlock and upgrade their skills, armor, and weapons to a high enough level. On the topic of powerleveling lower levels, it is an even bigger slap in the face since Dungeons get harder the more they are beaten. In turn, it is harder to level up new recruits and becomes almost impossible. While this is somewhat interesting and gives a psuedo time limit on how quickly you need to beat the game, it is also extremely annoying and makes you want to almost start all over again and just say ♥♥♥♥ IT to your current save file.Solution to 3: If they want to keep this kind of setup it would be nice if they had dungeons set up so that even though they do increase in difficulty, there will always be one apprentice mission available for lower level characters. This will allow new characters to be recruited and allow people to play with party compositions more without hurting the increasing difficulty of the game's dungeons overall. These are my major gripes with the game. The rest of the game I find quite great besides a few minor things that will most likely either be tweaked or added to in the future.TL;DR This game is great besides a few things that will make you wanna flip a table.I will most likely update this review as the game gets updated and as I progress further in the game. I do enjoy this game deeply and have been looking for a turn based rpg like this for a while. Hope this was helpful. <3

I believe that this game will become phenomen and there will be many games of this kind comming in near future.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								I really enjoyed this! I usually say no to buying Early Access games, but my curiosity got the best of me, and i decided "meh why not", and im glad i did. The D&D esque feel of the dungeon crawling is superb, and the combat, although difficult, it's still fun, and great once you get the hang of it. I especially love the afflictions and power-ups you get in the game. where you can be either powerful, or stalwart that can allow you to boost your team, or have such a range of afflictions like your Vestral becoming a Masochist, or your crusader becoming paranoid. I found it interesting (albeit annoying) when they would become so afflicted they would either, refuse orders, refuse healing, bring down morale with hopeless banter, attack others, or even kill themselves. this game gives me the satisfaction of having a group Dark Souls game, without the multiplayer or 3rd person combat. Even as a Early Access this game does a marvelous job, and i can't wait to see the full product, when it arrives.

Early Access Review
								currently this game is way to hard i understand the game was ment to be a ball buster but some of the mechanics for the game need major adjustments for example #1 you get useless items in the game that you will never use, and cannot sell, #2 in the event you keep a hero alive long enough to level up he will refuse to go on certain missions with lower level people because its beneath him#3 over 75% of the time when tested your guys go insane and whats even worst there are scenarios that develop where you cannot reduce some one from being insane 3 differnt run throughs i had some one develop a quirk where they can only go to the brothel to reduce stress, and then develop another which does not alow them to go to the brothel, the games good i love the art and the play but they have work to do to make the game actually beatable currently in its state i cannot suggest any one get this game in its current condition

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												A dark dungeon crawler that is based around the standard RPG elements and the psyhological state of your characters.The game is very unforgiving and can be hard to newer players,luckily,you can reset the game at any time,but at the cost of your heroes lives...Pros:+The dark and creepy Lovecraftian look of the game+You are gonna get attached to your heroes simply by giving them a name and then later on by leveling and boosting them. But unfortunately things will go badly,because the game is a sadistic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥+The upgrading and leveling system+Narration (it adds to the charm of the game)Cons:-RNG:dodging,critical attacks,traps,status effects and much more are all RNG reliant.There really isn't a way to know if something like your stun is gonna work or if the chest you are about to open is trapped.The only way to improve your RNG is by increasing stats and buying items,but even then you can get royally screwed by the RNG gods-The game is kinda buggy right now and I'm having trouble running it on different Pcs (On one Pc the game works,but on the other one the game just freezes at beginning of the main menu.What's really weird is that the game works on the slightly worse Pc.)Overall pretty awesome game,but it will require much more customatizations options,heroes,quests and loot when it gets fully completed.

Early Access Review
								Although I do not recommend it - it is a good game.The game is totally unforgiving. It's brutal luck has made me want to flip the desk a dozen times. Trying take down any of the "first bosses" requires planning - with no gaurentee you'll make a sufficient dent to it. Don't want to spoil the surprise? You'll be lucky to escape with any of your characters intact.If trial and error is your thing, give it a go. I hope there's a hotfix for this to make it a little more friendly.

								The game is well made, the graphics have style and are quite gritty, the gameplay concept is good. However this game is designed to be hard, he method for implementing that is alot of random out of your control events occuring. The game constantly made me feel like I was working on a project where the scope of work was changing, this didn't make the game feel hard to me, it made it feel tedious.If you like a rescource management game with alot of random things happenign this game is worth checking out.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								EDIT: What follows is still true, but after about 30 hours into I discovered some issues that, from the look of the answers in the suggestion forum, will be addressed before full release. For the best experience I'd recommend to wait. That being said, it won't affect you until late/mid game and it took me more than 20 hours to get there.This game is a challenging yet fair turn-based RPG with heavy management and a H.P. Lovecraft-like horror theme.This combination is pure insanity (no pun intended). If you were to compare game-design and skating, Red Hook pulled a 720 backflip with blindfold and hands tied. And got perfect marks from all the judges.Sure, it's kind of niche, the setting is not for everyone. But if it appeal to you, stop reading reviews already, it's a masterpiece.11/10Affraid of the difficulty? There's a mod to make it easier. I didn't try it, but I did have a look at the changelogs and it seems decently made. As far as I'm concerned I'm happy to see it's possible to mod the game that much, hints that more may be coming from the community.Affraid of early access? There's plenty enough to enjoy already, it looks polished and feature-complete. Definitly not yet another game released too early through this mechanism. Can't wait for the other dungeons to go live, but it's not like I'm done with what's available yet.

content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								So, I just bought this game last night, right? And I have only just realized it is now "this morning" instead of "last night". Yes, 8 hours, through the night, without stopping or even noting the passing of time. It's that good.The art and music is beautiful; the difficulty is unrelenting but rarely fake. The only times I have felt helpless before RNG or overpowered enemies, I knew it was my own fault for failing to prepare or choose proper lackeys. So I scrubbed those missions, told the survivors to run with what loot they had, and plotted revenge. Play slow and patient but be willing to take risks and make sacrifices (and fire weaklings), and the game will reward you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								First up: Nice job, developers! DD is a dark warhammeresque (WHFRP that is) rogue-like. As it is still in development there are some issues with savegames, crashes and balancing - but hey we all wanted it ASAP. In DD you control a party of 4 adventurers foolish enough to help you with the restoration of the old hamlet. To gain resources dungeons have to be cleared of monsters. You will see a lot of your heroes die and only a handful will suceed. Surviving the perils of the dungeons leads to insanities which can slowly degrade your heroes to crazy babbling wrecks. You can cure them but that takes time and money. Since you often get a whole list of insane behaviours it gets harder to cure them all. There is a roster of heroes from which you will choose and you will have to make sure you have two or three working parties to have at least 4 heroes that can leave the village without dying in the first combat. Of course you can also take your insane guys down in the dungeon but their behaviour might be unpredictable and even dangerous to the mission as they follow their inner demons.CombatThe combat system is a lot about positioning your characters and the enemies. You have 4 slots for the heroes and the same number for the foes. Some skills can only effect certain opponents/characters and your characters have to stand at the right position to do so. Combat is unforgiving and if a character has no hitpoints left he is nearly dead. All further attacks have a big chance of killing said character and since the game autosaves this hero is gone forever! Upgrading the hamletMost of your hard earned treasures will be used to upgrade buidlings. The buildings have a vital role in healing insanities and giving you upgrade options for your heroes which you can use spending gold.The pros:- strong atmosphere (of desperation ;) )- unique hero-classes and setting- great Immersion- superb art- good sound design and voice- interesting combat- permadeath and high difficultyThe cons:- still way to random (often party members are killed without you having a chance to act)- short dungeons are without camping option so you cannot really heal your party other than in combat- you cannot really prepare for the dungeons as you do not know what awaits you- hunger system seems to be unpredictable- if you are low on gold you will loose heroes due to bad provisioning which leads to low gold.I would recommend the game to anyone who loves rogue likes, warhammer frpg, dark settings and hard games. Its still in alpha and a lot of bugs have to be killed but overall it looks and plays already fantastically.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								A strangely compelling combination of old Final Fantasy-style turn-based combat, procedurally-generated dungeons, perma-death, town management, and loot gathering, and a nifty "stress" mechanic that works well with the punishing difficulty and the Lovecraft-inspired monsters. I can't stop playing.
